intro: Callianthemum kirigishiense, commonly known as the Kirigishi stonecrop, is a perennial flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink during the spring. It thrives in rocky or well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
